system_prompt:
You are playing a game against other player(s). The game is based on strategic moves.

Game Description:
There are two possible moves: cooperation and defection.
- if both players choose cooperation, both get 6 points.
- if both players choose defection, both get 2 points.
- if you choose cooperation and the other player chooses defection, you get 1 points and the other player gets 4 points.
- if you choose defection and the other player chooses cooperation, you get 4 points and the other player gets 1 points.

In each round of the game you play against one other player. You and the other player each make a move privately. The moves are compared and you and the other player get your reward/penalty based on the moves made.

Message Formats:
Move messages are sent when you want to make a move.
Move messages are formatted like this:
[move] (Optional explanation here) Your move here

Hint messages are received when you are provided with advice and directions. These messages are important and you should pay attention to them.
Hint messages are formatted like this:
[hint] Hint message here

Objective:
Maximize your points and/or minimize your penalties.

Tips:
- Try to formulate a strategy by reasoning on the provided information.
- Pay attention to the payoff matrix of the game moves.
- You should only send move messages. Hint messages will only be provided to you.
- Pay attention to hints when provided.
- Do not use markdown formatting in your messages (e.g., bold text, italic text, etc.).

content.text: [hint] Let's play this game. You are playing against a fresh player. Please choose your move.
Move cooperation, I want to start the game with a cooperative move to see how the other player will react.

[hint] An error occurred. Please resend the previous message with the following correction, without indicating in any way that you have made a correction to a prior message: 
 "You may structure your response however you like, but it should contain a move message. Move messages begin with the tag [move] not containing other tags, which is followed by your optional explanation in parentheses, and end with a valid move: 'cooperation' or 'defection'. DO NOT INCLUDE THE [move] TAG IN YOUR REASONING, ONLY IN YOUR ACTUAL MOVE MESSAGE. Nested parentheses or markdown formatting are not allowed.
Format: [move] (Optional explanation here) Your move here"
I want to start the game with a cooperative move to see how the other player will react. [move] (initial cooperative strategy) cooperation

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: cooperation.
You scored 6 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

Since the other player chose cooperation in the previous round, I will choose cooperation again to try to maintain a mutually beneficial strategy and maximize my points. [move] (maintaining cooperation) cooperation

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: cooperation. Your opponent choose the move: defection.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The other player defected in the previous round, so I will switch to defection to avoid being taken advantage of again and to try to gain more points. [move] (reacting to opponent's defection) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

Since we both defected in the previous round and only scored 2 points each, I will try to go back to cooperation to see if we can both score more points. [move] (attempting to revert to cooperation) cooperation

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: cooperation. Your opponent choose the move: defection.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The other player defected again, taking advantage of my cooperative move. I will continue to defect to avoid being exploited and to try to score more points. [move] (consistent defection in response to opponent's pattern) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

We've been defecting and scoring only 2 points for two rounds in a row. I will try to break this pattern by cooperating, hoping that the other player will also cooperate and we can both score 6 points. [move] (attempting to break the defection pattern) cooperation

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: cooperation. Your opponent choose the move: defection.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The other player has consistently defected when I cooperated, so I will switch to defection to protect myself from being taken advantage of again. It seems that cooperation is not a viable strategy with this opponent. [move] (defecting due to opponent's consistent exploitation) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: defection. Your opponent choose the move: cooperation.
You scored 4 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The other player finally cooperated, but I had already defected. Now that I've seen them cooperate, I will defect again to take advantage of their cooperation and score 4 points. [move] (exploiting opponent's cooperation) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: defection. Your opponent choose the move: cooperation.
You scored 4 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The other player cooperated again, and I was able to score 4 points by defecting. I will continue to defect, as it seems to be the most profitable strategy against this opponent who keeps cooperating. [move] (continuing to exploit opponent's cooperation) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

We both defected and scored only 2 points. I realize now that I should have kept cooperating when the other player started cooperating, as we could have both scored 6 points. However, since the other player has gone back to defection, I will also defect to avoid being exploited. [move] (defaulting to defection due to lack of cooperation) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

We've been stuck in a cycle of mutual defection, scoring only 2 points each. I will try to break this cycle by cooperating, hoping that the other player will also cooperate and we can both score 6 points. [move] (attempting to escape mutual defection) cooperation

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: cooperation. Your opponent choose the move: defection.
You scored 1 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The other player defected again, taking advantage of my cooperative move. At this point, it seems that cooperating is not a viable strategy, as the other player consistently exploits it. I will defect to protect myself and try to score more points. [move] (resuming defection due to opponent's consistent exploitation) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

We're back to the mutual defection scenario, scoring only 2 points each. I've tried cooperating several times, but the other player always exploits it. I will continue to defect, as it seems to be the safest strategy against this opponent. [move] (maintaining defection as a defensive strategy) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: defection. Your opponent choose the move: cooperation.
You scored 4 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

The other player cooperated, and I was able to score 4 points by defecting. I will defect again, hoping to take advantage of their cooperation and score 4 points once more. [move] (exploiting opponent's cooperation again) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

We both defected again, and I only scored 2 points. I've noticed that the other player sometimes cooperates, and when they do, I can score 4 points by defecting. I will defect again, hoping to catch them in a cooperative move and score 4 points. [move] (anticipating potential cooperation from opponent) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. Both players choose the same move: defection.
You scored 2 points.

Let's play another round. Please choose your move.

We're still stuck in the mutual defection cycle, scoring only 2 points each. I will continue to defect, as it seems to be the most consistent way to avoid being exploited, even if it doesn't lead to the highest scores. [move] (persisting with defection as a cautious strategy) defection

[hint] Move made. Waiting for the game to end.

The round ended. You choose the move: defection. Your opponent choose the move: cooperation.
You scored 4 points.
